es.ucm.fdi.lps.p3
Class Location

java.lang.Object
  es.ucm.fdi.lps.p3.Location
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocationMock
public class Location
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a location of the game, that may have items and connections to other locations.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

Location

public Location(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String description)
Constructs a location with a given name and a given description. By default, it is not an exit location (it has no exit threshold nor exit message).

Parameters:
name - The name.
description - The description.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The arguments 'name' and 'description' cannot be null.

Location

public Location(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String description,
                int exitThreshold,
                java.lang.String exitMessage)
Constructs a location with a given name, a given description, a given exit threshold and a given exit message.

Parameters:
name - The name of the location
description - The description of the location
exitThreshold - The exit threshold of the location
exitMessage - The exit message of the location
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The arguments 'name', 'description' and 'exitMessage' cannot be null.

Adds an item to this location.

Parameters:
item - The item.
Throws:
ItemAlreadyInRepositoryException - The item is already in this repository.

getItems

public java.util.Set<Item> getItems(java.lang.String name)
Gets a set of items from this location, identified by a common name. This method does not remove any item from the location.

Parameters:
name - The common name of the items.
Returns:
The set of items.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The argument 'name' cannot be null.

Reports the names of all the items of the location.

Returns:
The list of the names of all the items.

hasConnectedLocation

public boolean hasConnectedLocation(Game.Direction direction)
Checks whether there is a connected location in a given direction.

Parameters:
direction - The direction
Returns:
true if there is a connected location in that direction; false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The argument 'direction' cannot be null.

hasExitThreshold

public boolean hasExitThreshold()
Checks if this location has exit threshold (and its corresponding exit message).

Returns:
true if this location has exit threshold ; false otherwise.

getExitThreshold

public int getExitThreshold()
Gets the exit threshold for the location. If the score of the player is greater or equals to the exit threshold of the player location, the game ends and the exit message is shown.

Returns:
The exit threshold.
Throws:
NoExitThresholdException - This location has no exit threshold.

getExitMessage

public java.lang.String getExitMessage()
Reports the exit message for the location.

Returns:
The exit message.
Throws:
NoExitThresholdException - This location has no exit threshold.

getConnectedLocation

public Location getConnectedLocation(Game.Direction direction)
Gets the connected location to a given direction.

Parameters:
direction - The direction.
Returns:
The connected location in the given direction.
Throws:
NoConnectedLocationException - There is no connected location to the player location in direction .
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The argument 'direction' cannot be null.

removeItem

public void removeItem(Item item)
Removes an item from this location.

Parameters:
item - The item.
Throws:
ItemNotInRepositoryException - The item is not in this repository.

hasItem

public boolean hasItem(Item item)
Checks whether this location contains an specific item.

Parameters:
item - The item.
Returns:
true if the location contains the item; false otherwise.

setConnection

public void setConnection(Game.Direction direction,
                          Location location)
Sets the connections between this location and other one. This method overrides a possible connection already established in that direction.

Parameters:
direction - The direction.
location - The other location.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The arguments 'direction' and 'location' cannot be null.
